__e: Helena, I know you want to tell me.
Helena... I'm s... I'm sorry if I'm not the, uh... person that you wanted me to be.
Helena, I can't even remember how to say hello to a girl at a bar.
I mean, Helena told the story so much-- about her husband and how he lies about his money.
Helena does have a soul, she does have a purpose, and she is part of our family now.
I mean, Helena's right. She can't stay with us. This is no place for a kid.
I had this running with Helena, and you'd be proud of me, I stood right up to her.
We need Helena's location, and you're going to tell me.
Go down and let Aunt Helena in and don't tell her about this, okay?
